content: a crafters welcome to the DMS craft today we're going to do a really cool
craft that will give a lot of atmosphere to your dungeon we're going to make a
demon door first I'm going to give you a preview on
the table what it looks like and then we'll head to our crafting table and
work on that and bring it to life riddle me this it is everywhere
you will meet it someday but not yet hopefully is it death that is correct
hey guys the main material for this project is this dollar-store foam core
foam board and I really like it because it's easy to remove the outer paper from
the foam core so that'll be the start of our project and here I cut out a square
it's two inches wide and I the total is at two and a half inches tall but I'm
measured in the center and cut a half an inch up to get the edges on the top of
the door okay so now I need to do the design on the door okay so I'm going to
do the banding so I'll just start going around the door with my ballpoint pen
and I really want to push into the foam board foam core to get the raised
texture of the door so now I'll start doing the demon face and I'm doing a
very stylized demon face I'm not worrying about making it look realistic
or anything it is a door after all so yeah make sure you're pushing into the
foam board to get that that texture because when we paint it
this will really pop out and you'll be able to see this texture which is really
cool an easy thing you can do with this foam
board and foam core so you can see I'm getting the horns on there
top of the head so I'll just keep adding details to this until I'm happy with it
and just like I said just pushing into the foam and now that demon face is
really starting to come alive do some more detail on the edging of the door
and finish up the demon there and make sure you're pushing in and some detail
around the eyes and there we go I wanna do a few cracks on the door so just push
those in there this is just a really easy technique now I pull the paper off
the back I just leave the paper on because it's easier to cut
the foam board with the paper on once one side I find at least so I actually
cut it on the side that has the paper so that makes it easier to cut make sure
you use a sharp blade also okay so there we go I've got the detail on both sides
the banding and we're ready to go now I need a doorframe so I'm going to just
measure around the door but I want to look and see where the corrugation lines
up against the door because I want to have the door be able to open and you'll
see how I do that later in the video so I'm just gonna trace around the door and
then measure out a half an inch from the door and then I will pull it up I'm
going to measure make the door three inches tall and then I'll cut it off at
the three inch mark so there we go there's our door frame now I'm kind of
out and I want to cover the corrugation with some cardstock so I've cut a
quarter inch cut or eighth inch card stock sorry and I'm using my hot glue
gun and glue it down it's hard to glue this stuff with white glue to get it to
stick on there so I usually use the glue gun for this kind of stuff so now I'll
go around the top just bend it over hold it for a few seconds and then same with
the other side that cover just covers all the corrugation then I just cut the
excess off okay so there we go okay now I want to do some detail on this door
and here's a really cool technique you can do a stone technique I'm just gonna
use the hot glue gun and just willy-nilly around on the cardboard and
not let it dry too much but then I'm going to pull the nozzle of the hot glue
gun through the through the hot glue that's still drying
and now I think I can get like the the stone block texture the edges where the
stone blocks joined together so I think that's a really super easy and neat
technique to do for stone blocks so I'll just keep just keep going around filling
that in and see you can see that detail looks really really great yeah I love
that I love that technique okay so now I've got my door and I want
to reinforce it a bit so I'm use my white glue and just dab some on and I'm
use a wet brush and just kind of spread it all over the piece I'm not getting it
on there too thick I'm just getting it on enough so that you'll get some good
coverage and I'm using this plastic tray from an old grocery thing so I can put
it on there without it sticking so that's that's why I've got the plastic
tray there and I'll just put on the edge and let it dry so there we go it's dried
up it's a little more sturdy and here I've got a top cocktail skewer and I've
kind of pushed it into the edge of the door since this foam core and I've got
that groove there see that so I just push that in and now I'm going to glue
that to the door so I'll just use my hot glue and push it on there that'll be my
hinge that'll be how I open the door so pretty cool but of course it's way too
long so now off to trim that but first I am going to glue this with some white
glue to give extra strength this will help just give some extra binding to
that to the door so let that dry up now I've got a base and I'm using cork and
it's an inch wide and I've measured half an inch into the center so I know where
the center is and to get the length of that I'm just gonna use my doorframe and
put it up against the cork strip and Mark it now I like the cork strip for
some reason it's a little weight and again it's housed it has some
texture on it too but I found that if you glue put glue on it like kind of
saturated the glue it actually makes it a little stiffer than it normally would
be and it's makes pretty for a pretty good base so I'm going to use this for
the base find it it's better than cardboard has a little more weight okay
so I'll just fill that all in with glue so that'll stiffen up a bit and then
I'll let that dry hey crafters I hope you enjoyed the first part of this video
make sure to check out the second part to finish up
craft also give your DM Scottie a like if he did like the video make sure to
share and subscribe and also why not join my forum and Facebook group a lot
of lovely people on there who love to craft and last but not least go for that
craft look I think I changed my mind let's go the other way
